at him. Dcnfsov, Rostov, and Nesvitski closed their eyes. At the same instant they heard a report and Dolo- khov's angry cry. 
"Missed!" shouted Dolokhov, and he lay helplessly, face downwards on the snow. 
Pierre clutched his temples, and turning round went into the forest, trampling through the deep snow, and muttering incoherent words: 
"Folly . . . folly! Death . . . lies . . ." he re- peated, puckering his face. 
Nesvf tski stopped him and took him home.
